@metadata.goal: The student can partition shapes into equal parts

steps.dialogue: Sam wants to share a candy bar fairly with a friend. Divide it so each person gets the same amount.

prompt.text: Divide the bar into 2 equal parts

step.dialogue: Not quite. Make sure both parts are the same size.

events.name: pulse_center
events.description: Center point of bar pulses to indicate where equal division should occur

step.dialogue: [event:pulse_center]Let's think about this together. For equal parts, each section needs to be exactly the same width. Try dividing right in the middle.

events.name: show_equal_division_line
events.description: Animated line appears at center showing correct division point, then demonstrates cutting motion

events.name: measure_halves_equal
events.description: Measurement overlay appears showing both resulting sections are equal width

step.dialogue: [event:show_equal_division_line][event:measure_halves_equal]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. To divide into 2 equal parts, we need to cut right at the halfway point. Watch as I show you where to place the cut so both pieces are exactly the same size. That's how equal parts work - each section must be identical.

on_correct.dialogue: You divided the bar into two equal parts.

@metadata.goal: The student can partition shapes into equal parts

steps.dialogue: You want to split a brownie with your sister. Cut the bar so you each get an equal part.

step.dialogue: Not quite. Cut the bar into two equal parts.

events.name: pulse_center
events.description: The center point of the bar pulses to indicate where to cut

step.dialogue: [event:pulse_center]Let's think about this together. You need to make two parts that are exactly the same size. Try cutting right through the middle.

events.name: show_cut_line_center
events.description: Animated cut line appears at the center of the bar, dividing it into two equal sections

events.name: measure_sections_equal
events.description: Measurement lines appear showing both halves are equal width

step.dialogue: [event:show_cut_line_center][event:measure_sections_equal]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. To make halves, we need two equal parts. Watch as I cut right down the middle of the bar. See how both pieces are exactly the same size? That's how halves work - two equal parts make a whole.

on_correct.dialogue: You divided the bar into two equal parts.

@metadata.goal: The student can partition shapes into equal parts

steps.dialogue: Three puppies are sharing a treat. Divide the bar so each puppy gets the same amount.

prompt.text: Divide the bar into 3 equal parts

step.dialogue: Not quite. Make sure all three parts are the same size.

events.name: sequential_division_strategy
events.description: Bar shows faint guide marks indicating where equal divisions would be placed

step.dialogue: [event:sequential_division_strategy]Let's think about this together. Each puppy needs the same amount, so the three parts need to be equal. Try spacing your cuts evenly.

events.name: animated_equal_division
events.description: Animated demonstration showing two cut lines appearing sequentially to divide the bar into three equal sections, with measurement lines confirming equal width

step.dialogue: [event:animated_equal_division]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. To give each puppy the same amount, we need three equal parts. Watch as I divide the bar - one cut here, and another cut here, making three parts that are all the same size. That's how thirds work - three equal parts make a whole.

on_correct.dialogue: You divided the bar into three equal parts.

@metadata.goal: The student can shade one part to represent a unit fraction

steps.dialogue: This bar is divided into two equal parts. Shade one part to show [fraction numerator=1 denominator=2]one-half[/fraction].

step.dialogue: Not quite. Shade just one part of the bar.

events.name: outline_one_piece
events.description: One piece of the bar is outlined to show which section to shade

step.dialogue: [event:outline_one_piece]Let's think about this together. [fraction numerator=1 denominator=2]One-half[/fraction] means one out of two equal parts. Choose just one section to shade.

events.name: shade_one_section
events.description: Animated demonstration showing one section being shaded while the other remains unshaded

step.dialogue: [event:shade_one_section]This can be tricky, so let's work through it together. [fraction numerator=1 denominator=2]One-half[/fraction] means we need one out of two equal parts. I'll shade one section now. See how just one of the two parts is shaded? That's how [fraction numerator=1 denominator=2]one-half[/fraction] works - one part out of two equal parts.

on_correct.dialogue: You shaded one of the two equal parts.

@metadata.goal: The student can shade one part to represent a unit fraction

events.name: outline_single_piece
events.description: One piece of the bar is outlined to show which single part should be shaded

step.dialogue: [event:outline_single_piece]You're working on it. Here's what helps - [fraction numerator=1 denominator=4]one fourth[/fraction] means choosing just one piece out of the four equal parts.

events.name: shade_single_section
events.description: Animated demonstration showing one section being shaded while the other three remain unshaded

step.dialogue: [event:shade_single_section]This can be tricky, so let's do it together. [fraction numerator=1 denominator=4]One fourth[/fraction] means 1 out of 4 equal parts. I'll shade one piece now - see how just one section is filled? That's how [fraction numerator=1 denominator=4]one fourth[/fraction] works - 1 part out of 4 equal sections.

on_correct.dialogue: You shaded one part out of four.
